greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of inversions in k-compositions of n for n >= 3, 2 <= k <= n-1.
comment: The Heibach et al. reference has a table for n <= 14.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 3..143, flattened
S. Heubach, A. Knopfmacher, M. E. Mays and A. Munagi, Inversions in Compositions of Integers, to appear in Quaestiones Mathematicae.
example: T(5,3) = 6 because we have: 3+1+1, 1+3+1, 1+1+3, 2+2+1, 2+1+2, 1+2+2 having 2,1,0,2,1,0 inversions respectively. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 19 2014
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=2..n-1), n=3..13);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 17 2011
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = Which[k == 2, Floor[(n-1)/2], k >= n, 0, True, T[n-1, k] + k/(k-2)*T[n-1, k-1]]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 2, n-1}], {n, 3, 13}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 14 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Row sums are A189052. The first column is A004526(n-1). Diagonal is A000217(n-2).  Lower diagonal is A002411(n-3). 2nd lower diagonal is A001621(n-4).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2011
